alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 4:48PM PST until December 06 at 2:47PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... South Fork Stillaguamish River Near Jordan Rd. Bridge affecting Snohomish County. Nooksack River At North Cedarville affecting Whatcom County. .Rain will slowly taper off over night and move out of the area Wednesday. For the North West Region...including Saxon Bridge, North Cedarville, Ferndale, Burlington, Concrete, Mt. Vernon, Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Stillaguamish River at Arlington. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, the Stillaguamish River will cause near record major flooding. Deep and swift flood waters will inundate many roads including Highway 530 east of Arlington and at Island Crossing and most valley roads downstream of I-5 to Stanwood. Levees are subject to overtopping and damage. Flooding will occur all along the river including headwaters...tributaries...and other streams within and near the Stillaguamish River Basin. This stage corresponds to Phase 4 in Snohomish County flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:35 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 20.6 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:35 PM PST Tuesday was 21.3 feet. - Forecast...The river crested this afternoon near 21.2 ft. and is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.16 feet on 12/12/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1015 PM PST.
